summary: "Capacity building" refers to the process of enhancing the abilities and competencies of individuals, organizations, and institutions within the EU framework to effectively implement economic policy. This concept is pivotal in fostering sustainable development and ensuring compliance with regulatory standards. Through targeted training, resource allocation, and strategic partnerships, capacity building aims to empower stakeholders, thereby facilitating better governance and economic resilience. In the context of EU legal and regulatory documents, it underscores the importance of equipping entities with the necessary tools and knowledge to navigate complex legal landscapes, ultimately contributing to the overall efficacy of economic policy implementation across member states.
